issues.title: User login fails with special characters in password
issues.summary: Users cannot login when password contains special characters like &, <, >
issues.description:
When users attempt to login with passwords containing special characters such as ampersands (&), less-than (<), or greater-than (>) symbols, the authentication fails with an error message "Invalid credentials".
                
                Steps to reproduce:
                1. Create user account with password containing special characters
                2. Attempt to login with these credentials
                3. Login fails with "Invalid credentials" error
                
                Expected: Login should succeed with valid credentials regardless of special characters
                Actual: Login fails due to improper handling of special characters

comments.author: tech.lead@example.com
comments.text: Initial investigation shows the issue is in the password encoding during authentication. The special characters are not being properly escaped before validation.

comments.author: security.team@example.com
comments.text: This is a security concern as it affects user authentication. Recommend implementing proper input sanitization and encoding for special characters.

issues.title: File upload size limit not enforced properly
issues.summary: Large files can be uploaded beyond the configured size limit
issues.description:
The system allows users to upload files larger than the configured maximum size limit (10MB). This can lead to storage issues and potential security vulnerabilities.
                
                Current behavior:
                - System shows 10MB limit in UI
                - Files up to 50MB are actually accepted
                - No proper error handling for oversized files
                
                Impact:
                - Server storage fills up quickly
                - Performance degradation during uploads
                - Potential DoS attack vector

comments.author: dev.team@example.com
comments.text: Started work on implementing proper file size validation. Will need to check both client-side and server-side validation.
